The fluidity of movement, absence of bugs or crashes, and abundance of engaging storylines and content make for an exceptional experience. Players have daily options, including multiple practice sessions, events like sponsorships, and actual games. This review focuses on the "MyCareer" mode, which I rate a perfect 10/10. The face scan feature worked excellently for me, though my first attempt amusingly resulted in a forehead that wasn't quite right. Additionally, using the MyNBA2K17 app allows you to perform face scans for free and earn daily VC. #sellout

original: Magic fans beware... Wizards is afraid to make a decent digital game. At its core magic the gathering is a social game. A game to enjoy with your friends (or frenemies) laughing, talking smack, and dropping game winning bombs. Wizards of the coast seems to have forgotten this. If you choose to play with friends you cant earn gold, and gold is important. Gold is so important that they have implemented a daily cap, understandable considering gold unlocks everything in game. But get ready for a long and boring 1v1 grind against the computer or random oponents, whom you can't even speak to. If you choose to play for free, it will take you roughly 4 hours a day for upwards of a month, by yourself, to unlock the cards.
polished: Attention Magic enthusiasts: Be cautious, as Wizards of the Coast appears reluctant to create a satisfying digital Magic: The Gathering experience. At its essence, the game is a social outlet crafted for camaraderie and competition—sharing laughs, playful banter, and triumphant victories with friends or friendly rivals. It seems that Wizards of the Coast has lost touch with this spirit. In the digital platform, playing with friends yields no gold, which is vital for progression in the game. Gold is so crucial that there's a daily earning limit, which makes sense, given that gold is the key to unlocking everything within the game. However, brace yourself for the tedious grind of 1v1 battles against either the computer or random opponents—with whom you can't communicate. Choosing the free-to-play path means enduring roughly four hours of solo play each day for over a month to gather the necessary cards.

original: Being the 3rd installment in the trilogy i'll get the bad stuff out of the way first. I quite hate pre-quals as it's technically going backwards in a story and not forwards (this is an issue for every pre-qual). Granted it offers more storywise. The combat feels sloppy and doesn't feel as sharp as arkham city managed to make it. As of writing this recommendation (26/10/2013) there is a game breaking bug that stops a side mission from ever being completed (main story not effected). Some gadgets are put at a rediculous hotkey that makes your hand have to travel the whole keyboard to get to it. It might sound like nothing, but while in combat it could potentially break your combo.
polished: As the third installment in the trilogy, I'll address the drawbacks first. I'm generally not a fan of prequels because they move backward in a narrative rather than advancing it (a common issue with all prequels). Nevertheless, they often add depth to the storyline. Unfortunately, the combat in this game feels less refined than the sharp mechanics achieved in Arkham City. At the time of writing this review (October 26, 2013), there's a game-breaking bug that prevents the completion of a side mission, although the main storyline remains unaffected. Additionally, some gadgets are assigned to impractical hotkeys, requiring you to stretch across the keyboard. This might not seem significant, but it can disrupt your combo in the heat of combat.

original: They basically fixed shadow warrior (2013) i.e. The bossfights are awesome, weapons feel very nice (maybe not as good as d44m's ones, but still solid), enemies aren't too spongy (if you're not too much of a retard with handling elemental and upgrade stuff). The upgrade system is really balanced and once you get around it, it's not too tedious. The elemental stuff and limited ammo softly forces you to use different weapons. Lots of cool unique (being the important word here while comparing sw2 to ♥♥♥♥♥♥ borderlands' formula of 'rng' weapons) weapons that stay viable through most of the game. The music is great, especially the main theme and of course stan bush's stuff.
polished: The developers have made significant improvements to Shadow Warrior (2013), particularly in the boss fights, which are now impressive. The weapons feel satisfying—while perhaps not entirely on par with DOOM's arsenal, they remain robust. Enemies are challenging without being overly durable, provided you effectively use elemental and upgrade systems. The upgrade system itself is well-balanced, and once you become familiar with it, it doesn't become onerous. The use of elemental features and limited ammunition thoughtfully encourages players to rotate through various weapons. The game offers a variety of unique weapons that remain effective throughout most of the experience, setting it apart from Borderlands' reliance on randomly generated weapons. The soundtrack is excellent, especially the main theme and the contributions from Stan Bush.

original: So many things was made wrong. I even dont know how to start this review. This all is refered to mycareer. My player is an outside scorer, pg, 1.71m, has maxed stats and got already all necessary perks. Ok, and now tell me, why the shooting skill depends to a person's hight? why a person who has 1.74m can not became so good in shooting as a person with 1.71m? i'm 1.87m in rl, made my first player with this hight and noticed then i can not reach a higher skill than 89. Why? thats a pure discrimination! and why the game does not tell me that before i create a char and not even then when i reach the skill limit after weeks of playing?!?
polished: There were numerous issues that I encountered, making it difficult to even begin this review. All my concerns are related to MyCareer. My player is an outside scorer, a point guard standing at 1.71m, with maxed-out stats and all the necessary perks. Yet, can anyone explain why shooting ability seems to be influenced by height? How is it that a person who is 1.74m cannot excel at shooting like someone who is 1.71m? In real life, I am 1.87m tall, and when I created my first player at this height, I noticed that I couldn't achieve a shooting skill higher than 89. Why is this? It feels discriminatory! Moreover, why doesn't the game inform me of these limitations before I create a character, or even alert me when I hit the skill ceiling after weeks of playing?

original: I think this assassin's creed nailed the mechanics down on all fronts (ship battles, sailing, hunting (fish), parkour, etc). I felt much more attached to this character as well. The story starts out extremely rough but does get much much better as you play (i think this is with every ac game personally). Edward was quite the interesting character and so was all the side characters. I felt like all the collectables actually meant something in this ac game that i never got from any of the previous ones and maybe its because i felt like they had a bigger purpose in the game. They def were not required but they were fun to get and you got rewarded in a very balanced way.
polished: In my opinion, this installment of Assassin's Creed has perfected its mechanics across the board, from ship battles and sailing to hunting and parkour. I found myself much more invested in this particular character. Although the story begins on a shaky note, it significantly improves as you progress, which I feel is a common trait in every Assassin's Creed game. Edward, along with the side characters, was truly captivating. The collectibles in this game felt meaningful, unlike in any previous iterations, perhaps because they seemed to serve a greater purpose within the game. While not essential, they were enjoyable to collect, and the rewards were well-balanced.

original: While i personally cannot recommend this game, it wasn't absolutely terrible. The gunplay is alright, so long as you have the money to purchase gun parts, which would be my main complaint with this game: it's pay-to-win. If i could get past that, the game would be enjoyable, as the hardsuit is fun to use and hrv is an excellent idea. I'd take this game over any call of duty title any day, but its pay-to-win microtransanction format is off-putting for me. If you are alright with this model, then by all means, have fun. But if you're like me and dislike pay-to-win games, just let this one slide; it's not our cup of tea.
polished: While I wouldn't personally recommend this game, it wasn't entirely awful either. The gunplay holds up well, as long as you have the funds to buy gun parts. This highlights my primary issue with the game: it's heavily reliant on a pay-to-win model. If I could overlook that aspect, the game would actually be quite enjoyable. The hardsuit is a blast to use, and the HRV feature is a fantastic concept. I would choose this game over any Call of Duty title anytime, but its pay-to-win microtransaction approach is discouraging for me. If you're comfortable with this model, feel free to enjoy it. However, if you're like me and dislike pay-to-win games, it's best to pass on this one; it simply isn't suited to our preferences.

original: While not perfect, this game has been greatly enjoyable. The save system and possibility of sudden death leads to some frustration. I'm on my first playthrough and i lost my main character around hour 10 of 20ish. Would have really liked a save to reload at that point. I've since picked up a 3rd party mod/save tool to avoid catastrophic failures. Plus the aiming reticule is on the small side and zoom is underpowered. With all that said, its been a blast. I'm not normally a zombie fan, but the combination of strategy, missions, first person shooter/beat em up is great. I've been playing it as often as i can get away... Just one more mission, just one more supply run - or i'm running away and want to get safe before shutting the game down.
polished: Although not without its flaws, this game has provided a highly enjoyable experience. The save system and the potential for sudden character death can be frustrating. During my first playthrough, I lost my main character around the 10-hour mark of a 20-hour game. I would have appreciated having a save point to restart from at that moment. To address this, I've started using a third-party mod or save tool to prevent such setbacks. Additionally, the aiming reticle feels a bit too small, and the zoom feature could be more powerful. Despite these issues, the game has been a thrilling ride. While I don't usually gravitate towards zombie-themed games, the blend of strategy, missions, and the first-person shooter/beat 'em up elements is fantastic. I find myself playing whenever I can, always tempted to complete just one more mission or make one more supply run—or sometimes escaping to a safe spot before I log out.

original: An absolute great stragtegy game! having played every single other wargame (european escalation, and alb), i have to say this one fits well. The number of units are great. Not sure exactly how many units there are, but there's a crap ton!!! graphics are just beautiful, sounds are great, and the gameplay overall is epic. The ingame chat box at the main menu is very entertaining as well, no i am not kidding. However, if anyone thinking this game is 'easy', or if you are new to the strategy genre, it could take you quite some time to get it nailed down. Do not get upset, you will lose a lot of units. Just make sure you plan ahead, always have anti-air, and anti-tank.
polished: This strategy game is truly exceptional! Having played every other war game, including European Escalation and ALB, I can confidently say this one fits in seamlessly. The sheer number of units available is impressive, and while I can't pinpoint the exact count, there are a vast amount to choose from! The graphics are stunning, the audio is immersive, and overall, the gameplay is nothing short of epic. Even the in-game chat box at the main menu is surprisingly entertaining. However, for those who expect an 'easy' experience or are new to the strategy genre, be prepared for a learning curve. Don't be discouraged by losses; you will lose many units. Just ensure you plan strategically, and always include anti-air and anti-tank defenses.

original: I was negatively biased towards this game before i played it. Wasn't even sure about buying. I dunno, the whole portal gun and portals thing seemed weird to me even though i like science fiction. Boy was i wrong. The jokes and voice acting in this game is phenomenal. Just amazing. It's not cheesy (ok it's sometimes cheesy). And different story characters have all their own sense of humour. Those different characters do really have different personalities. And the level design; it's just rad. Btw i never played the first portal game. One of these days, i'm planning to if i can spare the time. I would never have played it if i hadn't played the sequel.
polished: Initially, I had a negative bias towards this game and was hesitant to purchase it. The concept of a portal gun and portals struck me as peculiar, even though I'm a fan of science fiction. However, I was pleasantly surprised. The humor and voice acting in this game are outstanding—absolutely remarkable. Although there's an occasional hint of cheesiness, each character possesses a distinct sense of humor and personality, adding depth to the story. The level design is simply spectacular. I must mention that I never played the first Portal game, but after experiencing the sequel, I am now considering making time to play it someday. Had it not been for the sequel, I might never have given it a try.

original: Ok lets start on the pros(+) and cons(-) then my thoughts on this game. +some of the best charecters +good story +lods of content +customisible charecter ( you can be male or female whatever you like) +you can have a relationship with most of your companions(yes fangirls you can have a love intrest) -bad graphics ( i dont think graphics really matter anyway) -weird and akward love scenes -invisible walls -theirs one mission in my opinion was boring but everyone has different tastes -+ um this isnt really bad or good but for those who care your protaginist you made cant talk okay know for my thoughts. I love this game. This game is probubly one of the best rpgs or games in general i have ever played.so if your a rpg fan you proubly already have this game.
polished:
Let's delve into the pros and cons of this game, followed by my personal thoughts.

**Pros:**
- The characters are exceptional.
- The storyline is compelling.
- There is plenty of content to explore.
- The character customization is flexible, allowing you to choose a male or female protagonist.
- You can form relationships with most of your companions, appealing to those interested in romance.

**Cons:**
- The graphics are not very impressive, though I believe they aren't crucial.
- The love scenes can be awkward and poorly executed.
- There are many invisible boundaries.
- One mission felt dull to me, but it's a matter of personal taste.

**Neutral:**
- Your protagonist remains silent, which might not matter to everyone.

**My Thoughts:**
I absolutely adore this game. It stands out as one of the finest RPGs or games I have experienced. If you're a fan of RPGs, you likely already own it.

original: Yes, this is a nostalgia trip for thirty-somethings who remember (at least in the uk) watching the ever-irritating timmy mallet just for the five minute transformers cartoon. The voice actors for optimus, megatron, bumblebee, and many others are back, and instantly recognisable. The distinctive cartoon transformation sound is there. Graphically, the cell-shaded presentation is perfect, and very, very generation one. But aside from that, it's actually a very fun game. The combat mechanics are extremely well done. Transforming mid-fight is often a necessity, and woven seamlessly into combos, making it quite unlike high moon's excellent war for/fall of cybertron games. Another distinction is the heavy focus on melee combat, but some enemies (e.g. Seekers) require a switch to a ranged blaster.
polished: For those in their thirties, especially in the UK, this is a delightful trip down memory lane. It hearkens back to the days of enduring the often-aggravating Timmy Mallett just to catch the five-minute Transformers cartoon segment. Familiar voices like Optimus Prime, Megatron, and Bumblebee make their return, instantly sparking recognition. The iconic transformation sound from the cartoons is faithfully recreated. Visually, the cel-shaded graphics are spot on, perfectly capturing the essence of Generation One. Beyond nostalgia, this is an incredibly enjoyable game with expertly crafted combat mechanics. Transforming during battles is frequently necessary and seamlessly integrated into combos, offering a unique experience compared to High Moon's outstanding War for Cybertron and Fall of Cybertron games. Additionally, there is a significant emphasis on melee combat, although certain foes, such as the Seekers, necessitate switching to ranged blasters for effective engagement.

original: So i downloaded the game and played it for a little while, and it was nothing special. I spent more time trying to log in though than actually playing the game. There is a bug where it says that there was an update to the terms of service or whatever and whenever you clicked 'accept' it would just pop up again. You have to restart the client for it to work. Now that isn't that bad but why do i need to link my steam and gface accounts? they say it is for dlc but why is that even necessary? it is also not reversable so now i know that a company i don't care about has access to my steam information. Now the game itself is so so. It is easily recognisable as a cod clone, except somehow they made the gunplay worse... How is that even possible?
polished: I recently downloaded and tried out the game, but I found it quite underwhelming. I ended up spending more time wrestling with the login process than actually enjoying the gameplay. There's a persistent bug that repeatedly prompts for an acceptance of updated terms of service, requiring a client restart to move past it. Additionally, I'm puzzled as to why linking Steam and Gface accounts is necessary, supposedly for DLC purposes. This process is irreversible, which leaves me uneasy knowing that a company I'm indifferent about now has access to my Steam information. As for the game itself, it feels like an uninspired imitation of Call of Duty, with gunplay that somehow manages to be even less engaging.

original: 4k+ at 60fps (gtx 970), dual audio options and includes neptune gear. What's not to love? https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nygsb617tmo excellent port and a great entry point if new to the series. Just keep in mind there is lots of (skip-able) talking. As usual would suggest using a gamepad but personally i had no problems with a keymouse/mouse setup, both completely rebindable. Price is about right and wouldn't have been unhappy about a purchase. More then half the dlc is included free, which is still plenty to play with. Recommended game to all jrpg/anime/visualnovel fans, provided you don't mind long breaks between the action. Cheers. No commentary playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=plslfvijaupszez9af395mvnk63xnhsj1_
polished: This game offers stunning 4k resolution at 60fps with a GTX 970, includes dual audio options, and comes with Neptune gear—what's not to like? Check out the video here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nygsb617tmo. It’s an excellent port and a perfect starting point for newcomers to the series. Be aware, though, that there is a significant amount of dialogue, which you can skip if you prefer. While I recommend using a gamepad for the best experience, I personally encountered no issues with a keyboard and mouse setup, both of which are fully customizable. The pricing feels reasonable, and I would have been satisfied even if I had purchased it outright. More than half of the DLC is included for free, offering plenty to enjoy. I highly recommend this game to fans of JRPGs, anime, and visual novels, so long as you’re okay with longer intermissions between the action. Cheers! You can also explore a no-commentary playlist here: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=plslfvijaupszez9af395mvnk63xnhsj1_.

original: I experienced no performance problems even at release, and after all these patches it plays really well. Imo, this is a really great and fun game in truth, although the format may be somewhat annoying (where the free-roam city area repopulates with new enemies every time you progress the story). I particularly enjoyed the 'dual play' segments (where you can play batman + 1 more), and the ability to use the controller for most segments of the game but the mouse and keyboard for the tank combat segments was greatly appreciated. Driving your batmobile around the free-roam city, including when chasing the apc commanders, is actually quite enjoyable once you figure out how to use the breaks to skid around corners (and when you master that, driving around the city is really quite enjoyable!)
polished: From the very beginning, I encountered no performance issues with this game, even at its initial release. With all the subsequent patches, it plays exceptionally well. In my opinion, it's an incredibly fun and engaging game, despite some aspects that might be a bit irksome—such as the city area that repopulates with new enemies every time you advance the story. I found particular enjoyment in the 'dual play' segments, where you can control Batman alongside another character. The option to switch between a controller for most game segments and a mouse and keyboard for the tank combat segments was a much-appreciated feature. Navigating the Batmobile through the free-roam city, especially during pursuits of the APC commanders, becomes quite delightful. Once you've mastered using the brakes to skid around corners, driving around the city becomes a truly gratifying experience.

original: Damn fine aaa fps shooter - that's the bottom line. It's looks, sounds and plays great - great fps mechanics, nice story, cool characters, flawless voice acting, and a badass soundtrack. Not for the faint hearted though - some of those cutscenes were pretty darn cruel and vivid. But when a game overall is so great, it's easier to spot the flaws, and here they are as i saw 'em: - no sli support - wtf? i had to put the game away until i upgraded my card, as it ran too poorly on my old dual gpu gtx 590. Make sure you have a fairly decent single gpu card. - stupidly small obstacles are often unclimbable.
polished: This is an exceptional first-person shooter that truly stands out. Visually striking with impressive audio, it excels in gameplay, featuring robust FPS mechanics, an engaging story, memorable characters, impeccable voice acting, and an outstanding soundtrack. However, it's not for the faint-hearted; some cutscenes are quite intense and graphic. Despite its greatness, certain flaws become more evident: there's no support for SLI, which was frustrating. I had to pause playing until I upgraded, as it performed poorly on my older dual-GPU GTX 590. A reliable single GPU card is recommended. Additionally, some unnecessarily small obstacles cannot be climbed.

original: English is not my native language. I am dutch. So please ignore any typing/grammatical mistakes in my review of this fantastic game. I will break down this review in a few categories: - graphics - controls - sound - gameplay - replayability - graphics: the game has been set in a comic-like style. The graphics are very slick: no unnecussery details. Nice colour-scemes. It totally works for this game. The graphics can be set on 'high' without stressing your system. I run this game on an i5 pentium processor, with nvidia geforce 710m card - 8gb memory and it runs like clockwork (windows 8.1). - controls: the game can be played with keyboard and mouse, but also with an x-box controller.
polished:
English isn't my first language; I'm Dutch. Please excuse any typos or grammatical errors in my review of this fantastic game. I'll break down this review into several categories: graphics, controls, sound, gameplay, and replayability.

**Graphics:** The game is designed in a comic-like style, which works perfectly. The graphics are clean and well-defined, with no unnecessary details, and the color schemes are pleasing. You can set the graphics to 'high' without putting a strain on your system. I play the game on an i5 Pentium processor with an NVIDIA GeForce 710M card and 8GB of memory, and it runs flawlessly on Windows 8.1.

**Controls:** The game can be played using a keyboard and mouse or an Xbox controller, offering flexibility in how you choose to interact with it.

original: You can see by the hours i put into this game that i enjoy it. This is everything i wished a search game from cod would be. But dont buy this game thinking its like cod, battlefield, or any other shooter game. Its a game in its own class and should be treated as such. Cant tell you how many times i hear new players ♥♥♥♥♥ and complain about getting killed really fast. Oh god forbid you get shot in the face and ♥♥♥♥ing die. It's not like that doents happen in real life or anything. Edit:ok so ive been playing this game for awhile now. Thrown all kinds of money at it. One of the best mp games around. A good thing to play when your your not feeling cs:go.
polished:
The countless hours I’ve dedicated to this game are a testament to how much I genuinely enjoy it. It encapsulates everything I had hoped for in a search-based game, reminiscent of "Call of Duty." However, it’s important not to purchase this game with the mindset that it resembles "Call of Duty," "Battlefield," or any other traditional shooter. This game stands uniquely in its own category and should be appreciated as such. It’s astonishing how often I hear new players complain about getting killed quickly. Getting shot in the face and dying is, after all, a real possibility in real life. 

Edit: I've been playing this game for quite some time now, investing a significant amount of money in it. It ranks as one of the best multiplayer games available. It's an excellent option when you're looking for an alternative to "CS:GO.

original: I'm 2 hours in and am dying from this game. So funny. Gameplay is also solid, art design is beautiful, music is surprisingly high quality and appropriate, the story/world has me interested, and the puzzles are fun. But the best thing about this game beyond all that is the comedy. If you've played any rpg since the dawn of video game rpgs you will laugh at the various jokes, parodies, and references; if you've never played an rpg before then you should still enjoy the game for its humor. If you played final fantasy 7 or x you absolutely need to play this game, without giving too much away... I had to actually stop playing after 2 hours to give my cheeks a break from laughing and smiling so much. What a delight so far.
polished: After spending two hours immersed in this game, I find myself thoroughly entertained. It's incredibly funny, with robust gameplay, stunning art design, and unexpectedly high-quality and fitting music. The story and world are captivating, and the puzzles offer enjoyable challenges. However, what truly sets this game apart is its comedic brilliance. If you've experienced any RPGs since the genre's inception, you'll appreciate the clever jokes, parodies, and references that fill the game. Even newcomers to RPGs will likely find the humor delightful. For fans of classics like Final Fantasy 7 or X, this is a must-play. Without revealing too much, I had to take a break after two hours because I couldn't stop laughing and smiling. What a joy this game has been so far.

original: I'm really sorry, i try to be supportive of free-to-play games and indie developers, but i really didn't enjoy this game. The description sounded right up my alley, but the execution has done nothing for me. I love puzzle and exploration games, but i found this game to be completely unintuitive, and even after looking up how to progress i still just simply didn't find the gameplay itself fun. It also completely lacks a pause button, or if it does have one i never found it. Considering that a lot of sequences in the game are timed, this seems like a critical oversight. I also feel like this game is a lot more cut scene than it is game, and i end up just sitting around drumming my fingers a lot.
polished: I genuinely apologize, as I always try to support free-to-play games and indie developers. However, I did not enjoy this game. Its description seemed perfect for me, but the execution was lacking. Although I am a fan of puzzle and exploration games, I found this one to be entirely unintuitive. Even after searching for ways to progress, the gameplay itself failed to engage me. Additionally, the absence of a pause button—or my inability to find one—is a significant flaw, considering many sequences are timed. Furthermore, the game feels more like a series of cut scenes than actual gameplay, leaving me frequently tapping my fingers in boredom.

original: This game.... Phew where to even start. It was absolutely beautiful, from story to graphics i was hooked. The story wasnt just some story but actually felt like i was that person, trying to figure out what came next in the story that my character was telling. Gameplay was great and i learned alot about myself through this game (mainly my fear of hights which i never had a problem with until the ice caverns). My gut churned the whole time, but i kept through for uncle fred! if you guys made a dlc or second game, i would be the first to buy it and recomend it to everyone i know. Thanks to everyone who was involved making this, you made a absolutely beautiful game.
polished: This game left me breathless; I hardly know where to begin. The experience was stunning, captivating me from the story to the graphics. It wasn't just a narrative; it truly immersed me, making me feel part of the character's journey, unraveling what awaited in the tale they were weaving. The gameplay was exceptional, and I discovered so much about myself—especially my unexpected fear of heights, which became apparent in the chilling ice caverns. My heart raced constantly, but my determination to support Uncle Fred pushed me onward. Should you ever release a DLC or a sequel, I'd be the first to purchase it and wholeheartedly recommend it to everyone I know. My deepest thanks to everyone involved in creating this masterpiece; you've crafted an utterly beautiful game.

original: Sid meier's civilization beyond earth is a turn-based game in which you build your civilization to a certain goal or 'victory'. In previous games you were set on the earth's timeline going through periods like the stone age, medieval age, and the modern age; however, in this game you are set in the future on a mission to colonize a new planet. What i enjoy about this game is 2k took a new approach to the game and added some new mechanics such as the affinity system and orbital layer. What i didn't enjoy was that with these new mechanics the game could be overwhelming at times. What think could be improved on this game is that they could maybe incorperate some new artwork in the game such as the enviroment you experience when communicating with another leader.
polished: Sid Meier's Civilization: Beyond Earth is a turn-based strategy game where your objective is to develop your civilization to achieve specific goals or 'victories'. Unlike the previous installments, which unfolded against Earth's historical timeline—covering eras like the Stone Age, Medieval Age, and the Modern Age—this game is set in a futuristic scenario where your mission is to colonize a new planet. What I particularly appreciate about this game is that 2K Games took a fresh approach by implementing innovative mechanics such as the affinity system and the orbital layer. However, I found that these new mechanics could sometimes make the game feel a bit overwhelming. An area where I believe the game could be enhanced is by incorporating new artwork, particularly in the environments you encounter during interactions with other leaders.

original: Great game ! tons of replayability and very fun zombie survival game ! def. In my top 5 zombie games ever played. Edit: after playing 60+ hours i can honestly say this is one of the better more ''realistic'' zombie games. It's very much designed like a survival horror as you must save up your ammo, heal your own wounds when you bleed out, take pills when youre infected, etc. Also, i find zombies to feel very natual to be well animated for a free to play game. P.s. : i would recomend getting 1 or 2 friends to play with, but the community is super friendly and you can usually make friends/talk with the people in the chat or over voice comms.
polished: Fantastic game! It offers an incredible amount of replayability and is an immensely enjoyable zombie survival experience. It definitely ranks among my top five zombie games I've ever played. After spending over 60 hours with it, I can confidently say that it's one of the most "realistic" zombie games out there. The game is crafted in the style of survival horror, requiring you to conserve ammo, treat your injuries, and take medication when infected, among other aspects. Additionally, the zombies are impressively animated, especially considering it's a free-to-play game. Note: I highly recommend playing with one or two friends for the best experience, though the community is very welcoming, and you can often make new friends or chat with others in the game via text or voice communication.

original: 02/07/2014 - it's a shame i can't thoroughly recommend/enjoy this game as from the short time i've played it,i know i'd be addicted if it didn't have the following 2 game breakers. . No aussie servers - one red bar puts you at a severe disadvantage,and creates unbearable lag. Mind you,i played through the offline training mode and it was stuttering/lagging as well (how does that even happen?). Couple that with the poor ping,and it just ruins the game. . Everything artifacts like crazy - the menu's,backgrounds,training and in-game. I've never had this happen before with this card and thought it might not like my oc. Set my gpu back to stock and sure enough,it didn't make a difference.
polished: February 7, 2014 - It's unfortunate that I can't wholeheartedly recommend or enjoy this game. From the brief time I've played, I can tell I'd be hooked if it weren't for two major issues. First, the absence of Australian servers is a significant problem. Playing with a single red connection bar puts you at a severe disadvantage and results in unbearable lag. Incredibly, I even experienced stuttering and lag during the offline training mode (how does that even happen?). Combine this with poor ping, and it completely ruins the gameplay experience. Secondly, there's a severe issue with graphical artifacts affecting everything, from menus and backgrounds to training and in-game visuals. I've never encountered this problem with my current graphics card setup. I initially thought it might be due to my overclocked settings, but reverting my GPU to its default state made no difference.

original: Very late last night i finished this. The story is not very deep or interesting but what makes it stand out is the story-telling. The atmosphere is filled to the brim and the many collectibles do a great job at fleshing it out. I did learn a lot about the world of batman so it was a little disappointing that so few bosses were in the game. Oh well, there's enough future games to rectify that. The combat is the right amount of challenge but it's more on the easy side. Leveling up batman wasn't very satisfying. It's the gadgets you upgrade and acquire during the campaign which add for nice new gameplay mechanics. Getting access to previously unreachable places makes for a nice sense of progression.
polished: Late last night, I completed this. While the plot itself isn't particularly deep or captivating, the storytelling truly sets it apart. The atmosphere is richly immersive, and the numerous collectibles significantly enhance the experience. I gained quite a bit of insight into the Batman universe, but I was a bit disappointed by the limited number of bosses in the game. However, this seems like a great opportunity for future installments to address. The combat strikes a good balance in terms of challenge, leaning slightly towards the easier side. Upgrading Batman himself isn't the most satisfying aspect, but enhancing and acquiring gadgets throughout the campaign introduces refreshing new gameplay mechanics. Plus, accessing previously unreachable areas contributes to a rewarding sense of progression.

original: 'to the moon' is no mere game... Nay, it is a veritable experience, and it was one of the best of my life at that. Think telltale's the walking dead is sad? hohoho! well, it's no match for to the moon! never before have i been so depressed yet fulfilled over something purely fictional. This masterpiece represents the pinnacle of storytelling in my opinion, and the soundtrack is a gorgeously charming and perfect accompaniment. Yes, the controls are a bit finicky and the gameplay is not the strong point, but the story is so fantastic that i did not care one bit. Plus, the humor of the game is great as well and it definitely does not intrude upon the distinguished nature of the story... And the doctor who references are endless.
polished: To the Moon" transcends being just a game; it is an unforgettable experience, ranking among the most impactful of my life. If you found Telltale's "The Walking Dead" to be poignant, prepare yourself—"To the Moon" surpasses it in every way. Never have I felt so crestfallen yet simultaneously fulfilled by a fictional narrative. In my view, this work stands as a pinnacle of storytelling, complemented by an exquisitely charming and fitting soundtrack. Although the controls can be a bit cumbersome and the gameplay isn't its strongest suit, the story is so captivating that these issues seemed insignificant to me. The game also excels in humor, which is seamlessly woven into the narrative without detracting from its profound nature. And, for fans, there are endless references to Doctor Who to be enjoyed.

original: Bastion is a bloody brilliant game, with a really great storyline. Set after some calamity happened, you start to rebuild on the bastion. There's quite a lot of choice in the game, with the choice of what to build to give you an advantage, what weapons to use and what power ups to have on those weapons as well as what drinks to use to give you a bonus effect. The art style and music in the game is fantastic, everything looks so colourful at times, who says the apocolypse has to be dull. Best of all, the game has narration based on what you, the player do. So if you end up picking up a weapon then switch it for another in the armoury, the narration would say something of you taking along the new weapon.
polished: Bastion is an exceptionally captivating game with a compelling storyline. Set in the aftermath of a mysterious calamity, your journey begins with rebuilding the bastion. The game offers a plethora of choices that influence your progress, including decisions on construction for strategic advantages, selection of weapons and their enhancements, as well as choosing tonics that grant bonus effects. The art style and soundtrack are remarkable, infusing the post-apocalyptic world with vibrant colors, proving that the end times need not be drab. A standout feature is the dynamic narration, which reacts to your actions as a player. For instance, if you choose to replace one weapon with another at the armory, the narration adapts to reflect your decision, further immersing you in the game.

original: I had originally bought this game in early development, when the only currency was spacebux, and there was no 'tech tree'. This was when the game was good. All of the guns at this point were equally overpowered, so there was no problems with imbalance; everyone could kill everyone at any time. Also, the game used to give you unlimited gun slots and five loadouts. You would think that for a game with 'bajillions of guns', they would at least give you more than 6 weapon slots and 3 loadouts before you have to pay to get more. At one point, i had about 3 pages worth of guns, and was planning on new ideas for more, because personally, that's where i found it fun.
polished: I initially purchased this game during its early development phase, back when "spacebux" was the sole currency and there wasn't a "tech tree." At that time, the game truly shone. The weapons were all equally overpowered, which eliminated any issues of imbalance—any player could defeat any other at any moment. Additionally, the game used to offer unlimited gun slots and five loadouts. Considering the game's premise of featuring "bajillions of guns," you would expect it to provide more than just six weapon slots and three loadouts before requiring additional payment to unlock more. I once had an arsenal spanning three pages and was brimming with new ideas for expansion, as that was where I personally found the excitement and enjoyment.

original: This game was a surprising gem. One often sees rave reviews of certain products that are often misleading. In this case, the reviews reflect the fun of this neat little game. It is an odd mix between a classic 2d platformer and an moba, and does it with style. I found myself enjoying characters that i wouldn't enjoy in other moba games. I had expected this trait to continue, but decided to give a melee tank a go anyway. I was pleasantly surprised with the outcome and ended up trying out more as they were unlocked from playing games. The art style and interface is oddly charming. As such, i now use one of the characters as my avatar and a wallpaper from creating a card set for the game.
polished: This game turned out to be an unexpected treasure. Although rave reviews can sometimes exaggerate a product's appeal, in this instance, they truly capture the enjoyment this delightful little game offers. It uniquely combines elements of a classic 2D platformer with those of a MOBA, pulling it off with flair. To my surprise, I enjoyed playing characters that I'd typically overlook in other MOBA games. Initially, I thought this might not extend to all character types, but I decided to try a melee tank nonetheless. I was pleasantly surprised by the experience, which motivated me to explore more characters as I unlocked them through gameplay. The art style and interface possess a peculiar charm that captivated me. I even adopted one of the characters as my avatar and chose a game-related wallpaper after creating a card set.

original: I just started playing, but i love this game. I put on my headphone and lose myself in the game for hours at a time. It's been awhile since a game has had that effect on me. The music sets the mood, the sound effects are right on, and the controls are perfect. I look forward to every combat, and they've optimized combat extremely well. I had my doubt about the navel combat system, but it is so much fun to lay waste to multiple fleets at a time! the only way to lose in this game is to fail to retreat. If the combat looks overwhelming just get outta there, regroup, and counter-assault. Thanks, devs, for an awesome experience!
polished: I've just started playing this game, and I absolutely love it. With my headphones on, I completely immerse myself for hours at a time. It's been a long time since a game has captivated me like this. The music perfectly sets the atmosphere, the sound effects are spot on, and the controls function flawlessly. I eagerly anticipate each combat encounter, and the developers have done an excellent job optimizing it. I had my reservations about the naval combat system, but now I thoroughly enjoy decimating multiple fleets simultaneously. The only way to lose in this game is by failing to retreat. If the combat becomes too intense, just pull back, regroup, and launch a counter-offensive. Thank you, developers, for creating such an amazing experience!

original: The reboot of the devil may cry franchise has brought about many changes for the series, particularly for series’ protagonist, dante. While fans of the original series may be upset at the change to their beloved character, it’s certainly for the better; and this new game by ninja theory proves it. Dmc serves as the perfect point for newcomers to jump into the series. It shows the origins of an arrogant, cynical dante, and it chronicles his journey from cynicism to selflessness. Throughout, the game weaves a clear, narrative arc for the new dante, making him a compelling character to watch.image the story follows dante as he’s introduced into the corrupt world he willfully chose to ignore.
polished: The reboot of the Devil May Cry franchise has introduced significant changes, particularly affecting the series' protagonist, Dante. Although long-time fans might feel uneasy about the transformation of their cherished character, these changes are undoubtedly beneficial, as demonstrated by Ninja Theory's new game. DmC provides an excellent entry point for newcomers to the series. It explores the beginnings of a once cynical and arrogant Dante, detailing his evolution from self-interest to selflessness. The game skillfully crafts a clear narrative arc for this reimagined Dante, making him an intriguing character to follow. The story follows Dante as he is drawn into the corrupt world he had previously chosen to ignore.

original: Where do i start on this absolutely beautiful game. It's story, is absolutely charming. It has so much detail put into it, and it is a bundle of happiness, bad puns, annoying dogs, secrets. It is serious when it needs to be, but isn't a stranger to funny moments. The character design is on point, with there being various characters with various personailities and secrets to them. It sticks out from other rpg's because you don't have to kill anyone, which is an unused concept in rpg's. With lots of inspiration from earthbound, one of the best rpg's i have seen, you can tell that it is going to be good. It easily has the best soundtrack i've heard in forever.
polished: Where do I begin with this truly magnificent game? Its story is irresistibly charming, filled with rich details and bursting with joy, clever humor, playful dogs, and hidden surprises. It expertly balances seriousness with humor, offering funny moments when least expected. The character design is exceptional, featuring a diverse array of personalities, each with their own secrets. What truly sets this RPG apart is the unique concept of not having to kill anyone—an unprecedented approach in the genre. Drawing significant inspiration from EarthBound, one of the finest RPGs out there, this game quickly distinguishes itself as a standout experience. Moreover, it boasts an unforgettable soundtrack, among the best I've heard in years.

original: I am recommending this solely because it's free, and might be a more 'enjoyable' experience for others. As for my experience, the 'game' did nothing for me. Half the story relies on shock factor. I was not shocked nor emotionally moved in any way by this. Maybe i'm desensitized, or maybe it was too simple to warrant a reaction out of me. As for the other half of the game, it tries to paint a picture (literally) of a person in mental decline. It deals with obsession, hallucination, depression and a few other things. In theory it is a cool idea. But the 'game' took me 10 minutes to complete, and that is with reading and taking in every little bit of information i could.
polished: I'm recommending this only because it's free and might offer a more enjoyable experience for others. In my experience, however, the game fell flat. Half of its narrative relies heavily on shock value, which neither surprised nor emotionally affected me. This could be due to my own desensitization, or perhaps the content was too simplistic to evoke a response. The other half of the game attempts to portray the mental decline of a character, dealing with themes like obsession, hallucination, and depression, which is intriguing in concept. Yet, the entire experience lasted just 10 minutes, even with my thorough engagement in reading and absorbing every detail.

original: Do i even need to explain why portal is amazing? portal is a puzzle game, it gives you a concept then gets out. It is an amazing way to test your mind while still being fun. Although this game isn't as story heavy, it did give birth to one of the most good popular games of 2011. I still play this game and beat it when i am feeling bored and i love to come back and to see what gave birth to a legend and what is a legend. Gameplay: portal's gameplay is quite simple, to explain at least. You use portals to your advantage, along with buttons that activate a part of the puzzle. Two buttons are in the game, one that you press and one that you need a cube to put on.
polished:
Let me tell you why "Portal" is such a remarkable game. As a puzzle game, it introduces an intriguing concept and then lets you explore it on your own. It's a brilliant way to challenge your intellect while still ensuring you have a great time. Even though it doesn't focus heavily on narrative, "Portal" laid the groundwork for one of the most celebrated games of 2011. I still find myself revisiting it whenever I'm bored, enjoying the experience of reliving a true classic. 

In terms of gameplay, "Portal" is elegantly straightforward. You use portals to navigate and solve puzzles, incorporating buttons that activate various elements in the puzzles. These buttons come in two types: one that you simply press and another that requires a cube to engage.

original: If you can overlook the bugs (which i personally only had two: one minor and the other quite annoying) edit: both bugs are resolved one fix increased my fps from 60-90 to 80-120 and are looking for a space exploration game, i can definitely recommend this. Since most of these reviews are about specs, i'll include mine: i5 6600k (~200€) radeon rx480 (~200€) z170 pro - gaming (~150€) 16gb ddr4 ram (~70€) ~650€ is definitely within the medium price range though, granted, this rig is quite new. Almost constant 60+ fps on high settings vsync enabled i genuinely can't believe 90% of the comments saying they're rocking an overkill setup and get 20fps.
polished: If you can overlook the bugs—which, for me, were just two: one minor and one more annoying (both of which have now been fixed, significantly increasing my FPS from 60-90 to 80-120)—I wholeheartedly recommend this as a space exploration game. I noticed that many reviews focus on system specifications, so here are mine: Intel i5 6600k processor (approximately €200), Radeon RX480 graphics card (approximately €200), Z170 Pro-Gaming motherboard (approximately €150), and 16GB of DDR4 RAM (approximately €70), totaling around €650. This set-up is definitely in the mid-range price category, and it’s relatively new. I’m experiencing almost constant 60+ FPS with high settings and V-Sync enabled. I honestly find it hard to believe that 90% of the comments claim to have an overkill setup but still achieve only 20 FPS.

original: Remember age of mythology? yeah, it's been that long since there's been an rts game of such quality. Divinity: dragon commander reaches awfully close to these borders of my personal most favourite rts game. Combine this with a huge risk-like grand strategy mode and there, it hit the spot. I am not (read: try not to be) overly biased due to the fact that this game allows you to turn into a dragon, aiding your troops by supporting, attacking and even commanding unit production, direction and spawning at the very same time. Honestly, i do like the complicated rts games nowadays. Think of civ v and so on. However, such games attempt to cram complex mechanics, charts and resources all into one complicated game mode.
polished: Do you remember "Age of Mythology?" It's been quite a while since we've seen an RTS game of similar caliber. However, Divinity: Dragon Commander comes remarkably close to being one of my personal favorites in the RTS genre. It combines this with an expansive, Risk-like grand strategy mode that perfectly complements the experience. I strive to remain objective, but it's hard not to be impressed by a game that lets you transform into a dragon, assisting your troops through support, attacks, and even directing unit production, movement, and spawning simultaneously. While I appreciate the complexity of modern RTS games like Civilization V, these titles often try to pack numerous intricate mechanics, graphs, and resources into a single, convoluted gameplay mode.

original: Undertale comes together to make something greater than the sum of its parts. The graphics are solid for a retro title and the music is nice, but paired together they make some truly beautiful and impacting moments. The script runs the gammut from comedic to dramatic to heartbreaking to hopeful, sometimes all at once, and does this while turning rpg tropes on their head. And all of this without touching on the world, characters, story, gameplay... I could write whole pages about it. But instead, i'll just say this: if you like rpgs, play this game. If you like video games, play this game. If you have seven free hours between now and your death, play this game.
polished: Undertale transcends its individual elements to create an extraordinary experience. While its graphics effectively capture a retro charm and its music is delightful on its own, together they create truly breathtaking and powerful moments. The script is a masterful blend of comedy, drama, heartbreak, and hope, often intertwining all these elements simultaneously, all while cleverly subverting traditional RPG tropes. This doesn't even touch upon its world-building, characters, storyline, and gameplay, all of which deserve extensive praise. In short, if you enjoy RPGs, you should play this game. If you're a fan of video games, you must play this game. If you can spare seven hours in your life, make the time to play this game.

original: If you liked witcher 1 and 2, witcher 3 is must to get. I would give normally for this game 10/10 but unfortunatly after 1.03 this game turned into buggy ♥♥♥♥ + random crashes, so remember to save really often. When i played version 1.00 -> 1.03 my game never crashed, i didnt see any bugs. Also i have noticed that after 1.03 patch drawing distance sometimes is horrible, starting to draw objects when youre really close, sometimes even people. But if forgetting all these bugs, crashes and drawdistance 'bugs', this is really fantastic game, they made huge effort on quests, some of them really emotional and deep, lots of side quests, and the fact that your decision effects a lot in this game. I have played over 50 hours now and still going on.
polished: If you enjoyed The Witcher 1 and 2, The Witcher 3 is a must-have. Under normal circumstances, I would rate this game 10/10. Unfortunately, following the 1.03 update, it became plagued with bugs and random crashes, so I recommend saving your progress frequently. While playing versions 1.00 to 1.03, I encountered no crashes or bugs. However, with the 1.03 patch, I've noticed that the draw distance can be quite poor, with objects—sometimes even people—only appearing when you're very close. Despite these issues, this is an outstanding game. The developers have put significant effort into the quests, many of which are emotionally impactful and profound, accompanied by numerous engaging side quests. Your decisions have a substantial influence on the game. I have already played for over 50 hours and am still going strong.

original: I have only had this game for a few months, but in just that short amount of time, two dlc's have come out, along with patches that have made an already great game into an excellent one. The devs are very active in the community, and it really shows in the various discussion forums and dev diaries. There is a fairly steep learning curve to the game's mechanics of which i am still trying to learn; however, this breadth of strategy allows you a myriad of ways to reach goals and take advantage of certain situations. The game, in my mind, is almost infinitely replayable. I find myself sucked into every session i play regardless of how the play-through is going.
polished: I've only had this game for a few months, but in that brief time, two DLCs have been released, along with patches that have transformed an already great game into an outstanding one. The developers are highly engaged with the community, which is evident in the numerous discussion forums and dev diaries. The game's mechanics have a rather steep learning curve, which I'm still working to understand; however, this complexity provides a wide array of strategic options to achieve goals and capitalize on situations. In my opinion, the game offers almost endless replayability. I find myself thoroughly engaged in every session I play, regardless of how the playthrough is progressing.

original: Warframe is a fun game for the first few hours of play. After those few enjoyable hours you'll begin to see that the only thing left the game has to offer is repetition in it's combat, enemies and game play. The one major high point for the game is that the developers are working hard and do semi-frequent updates that generally include a lot of content from sweeping changes to some of the game's systems, new warframes and other tweaks/features. It's a good game to play casually. Though i doubt it will hold your attention beyond a few months unless you just really like grinding. The upside to all of this is that the game is free so i'd recommend trying it out. If you're looking for a quick fix, try it out.
polished: Warframe initially provides an entertaining experience that lasts for the first few hours of gameplay. However, after this initial excitement, players may notice a repetitive pattern in its combat, enemies, and overall gameplay. One significant advantage of Warframe is the dedication of its developers, who frequently release updates that introduce substantial content, including sweeping system changes, new Warframes, and additional features and tweaks. While Warframe is enjoyable for casual play, it may not maintain your interest for more than a few months unless you genuinely enjoy grinding. The silver lining is that the game is free, making it worthwhile to give it a try. If you're seeking a quick gaming experience, it's definitely worth exploring.

original: This game is so.. Very.. Boring. I bought this game because i believed it was a pc version of 'katamari damacy', a popular and nice ps 2 game. Sadly it's far from it. In this game you go about, absorbing ever bigger things to grow bigger and absorb bigger things. But the gameplay isn't as smooth as it could be, the levels not inventive and what is in it is a surreal horror show. I don't mean an entertaining horror show but, one that makes you rather depressed and rethink whether being alive is all it should be. Every 'living' creature in this game from small pets to human beings makes me wonder if the creators of this game had an interest in taxidermy.
polished: This game is incredibly dull. I purchased it thinking it was a PC version of 'Katamari Damacy', the beloved PS2 classic, but unfortunately, it falls far short of that expectation. The concept involves rolling up increasingly larger objects to grow bigger, but the gameplay lacks fluidity, the levels aren't creative, and the overall experience is like a bizarre horror show. It's not the entertaining kind of horror; rather, it leaves you feeling unsettled and questioning the very essence of life. Every creature in the game, from small animals to humans, feels lifeless, leading me to wonder if the developers had an interest in taxidermy.

original: Alright. Let me explain a few things, as a person very intrested in politics, i was very interested in this game when i first heard about it. I thought, 'oh wow! a simulator of the road to becoming president! that sounds fun!' well, it really wasn't. The game starts you off and says you need to pick a side: republican or democrat, there is no independent, or third party. A little dissapointed, but still optimistic, i carried on to see what i could do. I will give the game credit, the character customization, although limited, is pretty fun to mess around with. It's the only time its an option to wear your head or not in a campaign. Literally.
polished: As someone deeply interested in politics, I was initially quite excited to hear about a game simulating the journey to becoming president. I thought, "Wow, a game exploring the road to the presidency? That sounds intriguing!" Unfortunately, it didn’t quite meet my expectations. The game begins by asking you to choose between the Republican and Democratic parties, with no option for an independent or third-party candidate. Despite my slight disappointment, I remained hopeful and decided to proceed to explore what the game had to offer. I must admit that while the character customization is somewhat limited, it's quite entertaining to experiment with. It’s the only time in a campaign setting where you can humorously decide whether to wear your head or not.

original: Fallout 3 story was better. Settlements get in the way of the story to the point you'll hate baby sitting them instead of playing the story. Some keys are hard coded and cannot be rebound. Bugs galore. My pipboy disappeared permanently at one point and had to research console commands to get it back. You don't have to work for power armor it's basically given to you from the beginning of the game and power cores are everywhere in trader shops. Value of power armor diminished greatly from previous fallout games. Story is medicore, everything about this game is mediocre except it doesn't crash every 10 mins like fallout 3. Very stable compared to fallout 3. Is it better than fallout 3 no. Is it better than new vegas? no. This title was so overhyped for how bad it actually is.
polished: The narrative in Fallout 3 was superior. In the later installment, managing settlements becomes a hindrance to the storyline, causing frustration as you feel like a babysitter rather than engaging with the plot. Additionally, some controls are fixed and cannot be remapped, which can be frustrating. Numerous bugs are present; I encountered a situation where my Pip-Boy vanished permanently, requiring me to research console commands to retrieve it. Unlike in previous Fallout games, you no longer have to earn power armor—it's provided almost from the start, with power cores readily available in trader shops. This drastically diminishes the value of power armor. The story in this installment is lackluster, and the overall experience is average, though it is more stable than Fallout 3, which had frequent crashes every 10 minutes. Despite the stability improvement, it doesn't surpass Fallout 3 or New Vegas. The game was excessively hyped, which only highlights its shortcomings.

original: My stats (at the time of writing this review): - 8.6 hrs to get to the end - 10 collectibles found out of 25 - zero achievements out of 15 what i liked: - visuals up until the last level (ice caves) - story is not that great, but the ending (after the closing credits) kind of made me not regret so much spending my time playing this game what i disliked: - visuals in the last level are uninteresting - gameplay in the last level gets much harder making it become a frustrating experience of having to do a lot of things over and over again until you get it right - achievements are too hard. There are 13 (out of 15) that only less than 2,1% of players achieved!
polished:
At the time of writing this review, I've logged 8.6 hours to reach the game's conclusion, found 10 out of 25 collectibles, and earned none of the 15 achievements. 

What I liked:
- The visuals were impressive, particularly up until the final level set in the ice caves.
- While the story isn't particularly strong, the ending scene after the credits somewhat justified my investment of time in the game.

What I disliked:
- The visuals in the last level are rather dull.
- The gameplay in the final level becomes excessively challenging, leading to frustration as it requires repeated attempts to succeed.
- The achievements are overly difficult—only 13 out of 15 have been achieved by less than 2.1% of players.

original: Pros: +graphic cons: -bugs(especially the environment, you may get stuck or your shots may hit a invisible wall despite having clear line of sight of the enemy) -game is handholding/ babysitting you -dumb ai -enemies always seem to know where you are when you are spotted -godlike accuracy by the enemy which is frustrating like the first ghost warrior. -terrible checkpoints and saves. -boring story that i couldn't care less about will not recommend it unless its 90% off even then i find playing this game to be an extremely boring chore, just playing for the sake of finishing it to move unto the next game in my library. Considering the time i wasted on the first ghost warrior (which was equally boring and i feel liberated when i finished it), i probably won't play it until the end.
polished:
Pros: The graphics are impressive.

Cons: The game has several issues. Bugs are prevalent, particularly in the environment, which can cause your character to get stuck or result in your shots hitting invisible barriers despite having a clear line of sight to the enemy. The gameplay feels overly guided, offering too much handholding. The artificial intelligence appears poorly designed, and enemies always seem to know your location once you're spotted. Their accuracy is unrealistically perfect, reminiscent of the frustrating precision seen in the first Ghost Warrior game. The checkpoint and save system is poorly implemented, and the story is dull and uninspiring. I wouldn’t recommend this game unless it’s heavily discounted—at least 90% off. Even then, playing it feels like a tedious chore, endured only to move on to another game in my collection. Given the time I found myself stuck in the first Ghost Warrior (which was equally monotonous, providing relief only upon its completion), I doubt I'll play this one through to the end.

original: Review for 29/11/2015 do not buy this game, servers offline. You can't play. No compres este juego, servidores offline. No puedes jugar. While i could play it, i enjoyed it. As the song of the steve miller band...: go on take the money and run uh uh uhhh! go on take the money and run go on take the money and run go on take the money and run https://youtu.be/-wcfugcollu?t=54 --- english - 73 minutes playing the game omfg just an hour in this game! it's awesome! some guns are op and matchmaking it's sometimes unfair, but hey, bf3 it's worse matchmaking a newbie and the higher lvls players weren't real humans, you shot them in the face and nothing happens!
polished:
Review from November 29, 2015:

Do not purchase this game. The servers are offline, so you cannot play. No compres este juego, los servidores están fuera de línea, no puedes jugar. However, during the brief period I was able to play, I found it enjoyable. As the Steve Miller Band song goes, "Go on, take the money and run..." [Link to song: https://youtu.be/-wcfugcollu?t=54]

English Review:
After just 73 minutes of gameplay, I was hooked! This game is incredible. Some weapons are overpowered, and the matchmaking can be uneven at times, but compared to Battlefield 3, it's not as bad. In Battlefield 3, the matchmaking would unfairly pit new players against high-level ones, who didn't seem human as shooting them in the face had no effect!

original: Who wouldn't want to wear a fez? :d this puzzle platforming game stars a little guy with a fez who goes around collecting little bits to form a cube and navigating through a fairly large branching map. This game is quite amusing and running through it to complete the game was quite a bit of fun. ^_^ it can become semi-frustrating if you want to get all the cubes and achievements though. To get all the cubes you'll need to crack codes that you'll have to decipher. These can take a few seconds or frustrate you into looking into a guide (*raises hand* i gave up. -_-). The guide, 'a complete guide to fez!!!'
polished: Who wouldn't want to don a fez? This delightful puzzle platformer features a charming protagonist who, adorned with a fez, ventures through a sprawling, intricate map, gathering pieces to form a cube. The game offers an entertaining experience, and completing it is immensely enjoyable. However, the quest for all the cubes and achievements can be somewhat challenging. Acquiring all the cubes requires solving codes that you'll need to decipher. While some may be quick to solve, others can drive you to consult a guide (admittedly, I had to give in and look it up). The guide, aptly titled "A Complete Guide to Fez," can be a helpful companion.

original: It's not hard for me to see why other people like this game, but it wasn't for me. For one thing i have a vive and i'm much more interested in playing room sized games with the controllers. Beyond that, the game is initially awe inspiring in the scale of its universe, but i also felt that same scale was a hinderence to my enjoyment. The learning curve and the amount of time to do anything interesting at the beginning were both too large for me. Perhaps if i were more patient and had more time for gaming this would be compelling to me. But i don't have either and there are plenty more vr games i'd rather spend my time on.
polished: I can certainly understand why others enjoy this game, but it simply didn't resonate with me. Owning a Vive, I prefer games that utilize a room-scale setup with controllers. Although the game's vast universe is initially awe-inspiring, I found its size to be more of a hurdle than an asset. The steep learning curve and the considerable time investment required to experience anything captivating at the start were off-putting for me. Perhaps if I had more patience and gaming time, I might find it engaging. However, since I lack both, I’d prefer to explore other VR games instead.

original: Hands down my favorite first person shooter of all time. Run and gun rambos need not apply. Recoil and ballistics are realistic. Single hits to the chest, neck, or head from rifle caliber weapons almost always result in death unless it just grazes you. Rounds drop over distance and short, controlled bursts are required if you wish to remain on target. There is no magical ammunition pool. If you reload half-way through your magazine all the time then you will have a pouch full of half full mags. You can't run forever. If you sprint for a while your aim will suffer as you gasp heavily until you have caught your breath. Rest your weapon on your elbows while prone or on a window sill to steady your aim. Accuracy suffers when standing.
polished: This is unquestionably my all-time favorite first-person shooter game. It's not designed for those who enjoy reckless, run-and-gun tactics. The recoil and ballistics are incredibly realistic. A single bullet to the chest, neck, or head from a rifle-caliber weapon usually results in death, unless it's just a graze. Bullets drop over long distances, and maintaining accuracy requires short, controlled bursts. There's no infinite supply of ammunition—you'll end up with partially filled magazines if you consistently reload halfway through. Sprinting endlessly isn't possible either; after running for a while, your aim will falter as you catch your breath. To improve steadiness, rest your weapon on your elbows while prone or use a window sill for support when aiming. Standing accuracy is less reliable.

original: Let me start off by saying i did not purchase eu when it first came out and that i got it on sale which included ew so i never experienced the issues that some people claim to have had with that game. I loved that game however, it was unforgiving in the early stages but rewarding when you did things right. As for xcom2 i love it, the game plays pretty well for me on medium and i am running a gtx560 with 2gb of vram. At first the game set it to high and it was running a bit sluggishly but not to the point of being unplayable but when i dropped it down to medium it smoothed on out. Not sure if i am just lucky when it comes to having issues with games or what but it seems that most of the negative reviews sound like they are coming from some really entitled people.
polished: I must start by mentioning that I didn't buy the game "EU" when it was initially released. Instead, I got it during a sale that also included "EW," so I didn't encounter the same issues some players reported with the game. I really enjoyed it; the game was challenging in the beginning but very rewarding once you mastered it. As for "XCOM 2," I absolutely love it. The game runs smoothly for me on medium settings, and I'm using a GTX 560 with 2GB of VRAM. Initially, the game defaulted to high settings, and it ran a bit sluggishly—not enough to be unplayable, but noticeable. When I switched to medium settings, everything ran smoothly. I might just be fortunate with my gaming experiences, but it seems to me that a lot of the negative reviews are coming from people with unrealistic expectations.

original: +rpg levelling +wide-variety of ship types +physics-based movement for both ships and projectiles/missles +easy-to-learn resource management +dark humored -grind intensive (if under utilizing the civvy station types) -sub-par ai teammates -low variety of equipment types -low variety of levelling skills (that is, no branching) listen, this game is fun as hell. Despite my minuses up there, there is still some variety and strategy to be had. It starts off fast and still really picks up. Even though there's a low variety of equipment, it still feels like there's always another ship to unlock or skill to level up. The best way to increase the life of this game is the mods. Fight for universe is easily the star, but big fight for beef is also very good.
polished: The game offers a compelling RPG leveling system, a wide array of ship types, and physics-based movement for both ships and projectiles. It features easy-to-master resource management and a dark sense of humor. However, it can become grind-heavy if you don't make the most of the civilian station types, and the AI teammates are somewhat lacking. There's a limited variety of equipment and leveling skills, with no branching paths. Nevertheless, this game is immensely enjoyable. Despite its drawbacks, there is ample room for strategy and variety. It starts off at a fast pace and continues to be engaging. Although the equipment range is limited, there's always a new ship to unlock or skill to enhance. To extend the game's lifespan, mods are a key component. "Fight for Universe" is a standout, but "Big Fight for Beef" is also a great addition.

original: World leaders gather to face uncertainty more than 2,000 business and political leaders from around the globe are arriving in the swiss mountain resort davos for the annual world economic forum (wef). For five days, they will discuss issues ranging from china's economic power to iraq's future after this sunday's elections. Uk prime minister tony blair and south african president thabo mbeki are among the more than 20 government leaders and heads of state leaders attending the meeting. Unlike previous years, protests against the wef are expected to be muted. Anti-globalisation campaigners have called off a demonstration planned for the weekend. The brazilian city of porto alegre will host the rival world social forum, timed to run in parallel with the wef's ritzier event in davos.
polished: World leaders converge to confront global uncertainties as over 2,000 business and political figures descend on Davos, Switzerland, for the annual World Economic Forum (WEF). During this five-day event, topics such as China's economic influence and Iraq's future post-election will take center stage. Notable attendees include UK Prime Minister Tony Blair and South African President Thabo Mbeki, joining over 20 other government leaders and heads of state. In contrast to prior years, protests against the WEF are expected to be subdued, as anti-globalization activists have canceled a weekend demonstration. Meanwhile, the Brazilian city of Porto Alegre will host the World Social Forum, a counter-event scheduled to coincide with the more opulent gathering in Davos.

original: Deadline nears for fiat-gm deal fiat and general motors (gm) have until midnight on 1 february to settle a disagreement over a potential takeover. The deadline marks the point at which fiat will gain the right to sell its car division to gm, part of an alliance agreed in 2000. Gm, whose own european operations are losing money, no longer wants to own the unprofitable fiat unit. Reports of deadlocked talks sent fiat shares down 1.2% on tuesday, after monday's 4% gain on hopes of a payoff. The us firm is thought to be offering about $2bn (£1.06bn) to extricate itself from the arrangement. It has argued the deal was voided by fiat's decision to sell off fiat's finance arm and halve gm's stake via a capital-raising effort. The 2000 deal resulted from a race between gm and daimlerchrysler to ally with fiat.
polished: As the deadline approaches for the Fiat-GM agreement, both automotive giants have until midnight on February 1st to resolve their conflict over a possible acquisition. This deadline is crucial as it would allow Fiat to sell its car division to General Motors, a provision stemming from their 2000 alliance. However, GM, grappling with its own financial losses in its European division, is now reluctant to take on the financially troubled Fiat unit. News of stalled negotiations led to a 1.2% drop in Fiat's share price on Tuesday, following a 4% increase on Monday prompted by speculation of a lucrative settlement. GM reportedly proposes to pay approximately $2 billion (£1.06 billion) to disengage from the agreement, asserting that the deal was nullified by Fiat's decision to divest its finance arm and dilute GM's stake through a capital restructuring. The original 2000 agreement emerged during a competitive period when GM and DaimlerChrysler vied for a partnership with Fiat.

original: Cardinal criticises iraq war cost billions of pounds spent on conflict in iraq and in the middle east should have been used to reduce poverty, cardinal cormac murphy-o'connor has said. The head of the catholic church in england and wales made the comments on bbc radio 4 and will re-iterate his stance in his christmas midnight mass. The cardinal used a christmas message to denounce the war in iraq as a "terrible" waste of money. He and the archbishop of canterbury have both spoken out about the war. Speaking on bbc radio 4's thought for the day slot, he criticised the fact that "billions" have been spent on war, instead of being used to bring people "out of dire poverty and malnourishment and disease".
